verbs.description: ax (third-person singular simple present axes, present participle axing, simple past and past participle axed)

description: From Middle English axen, aksen, axien, from Old English ācsian and āxian, showing metathesis from āscian. Ax/aks was common in literary works until about 1600.

verbs.description: ax (third-person singular simple present axes, present participle axing, simple past and past participle axed)

entries.meaning: (now nonstandard or dialectical, especially African-American Vernacular and Bermuda) Alternative form of ask
examples: NOw loueres axe I now this questionWho hath the worse Arcite or Palamon?That oon may seen his lady day by dayBut in prison he moot dwelle alwayThat oother wher hym list may ride or goBut seen his lady shal he neuere mo
